title: English Language Arts
subject: Guidelines for Preschool and Kindergarten Learning Experiences (2019-)

B49B6FEC71544142B69BD064B3828720.description:
Use words and phrases
acquired through conversations,
activities in the kindergarten
curriculum, reading and being read
to, and responding to texts.

53C606534EFA4B72BBB5DD55F29D3F1A.description:
Use words and phrases
acquired through conversations,
listening to books read aloud,
activities, and play.

C8AAE605BE754736882C4F6448170AAF.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning
among verbs describing the same
general action (e.g., walk, march,
strut, prance) by acting out the
meanings.

31F4C32C9A164CB180465919B27800B6.description:
Identify real-life connections
between words and their use (e.g.,
note places at school that are
colorful).

BFC55295023E4E599156B0DCA86E8B02.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
frequently occurring verbs and
adjectives by relating them to their
opposites (antonyms).

2DC04BA1568D45BA87A84C48798A4406.description:
Sort common objects into
categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to
gain a sense of the concepts the
categories represent.

F260D1E2482441749DB57465364F704E.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, explore word
relationships and nuances in word
meanings.

660799BD0A0F445CB1DF72C6B67466FD.description:
Apply words learned in classroom
activities to real-life examples (e.g.,
name places in school that are fun,
quiet, or noisy).

CCBED5B7C65343A2906692517089E037.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
concepts by sorting common objects into categories (e.g., sort objects by
color, shape, or texture).

50B46BCF12854EF797BDE371FC88F136.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, explore word
relationships and nuances in word
meanings.

7110FC1AFE584FA6856593317F186247.description:
Identify new meanings for familiar
words and apply them accurately
(e.g., knowing duck is a bird and
learning the verb to duck).

6960977561764CA4B3DFB7C046815826.description:
Determine or clarify the
meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning words and phrases based on
kindergarten reading and content.

7CAB25742D5D4E399567172B3BDBE4DF.description:
With guidance and support,
generate words that are similar in
meaning (e.g., happy/glad,
angry/mad).

FCF328679FB04CB5B280B4C3D7BE6EA0.description:
Ask and answer questions
about the meanings of new words
and phrases introduced through
books, activities, and play.

EEA69FAA10DF4DC5A28AE04094B03DBD.description:
Write numbers 0-20 (see
kindergarten mathematics standards
for Counting and Cardinality).

78003A6ECA0E4E83905AA21A0D0B3897.description:
Spell simple words phonetically,
drawing on knowledge of soundletter relationships.

8CA9F73A945E430EB977ED6286136187.description:
Write a letter or letters for most
consonant and short-vowel sounds
(phonemes).

E6868DE11B3F4B88AEDCE1FB1232B07E.description:
Capitalize the first word in a
sentence and the pronoun I.

D52C12D523DD43F5B6C9F8E3A60A3B8F.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English
capitalization, punctuation, and
spelling when writing.

78A99DCD9A4241B681F1BDFF5FF4A1E6.description:
Form regular plural nouns orally
by adding /s/ or /es/.

36379C3B0CB545EA818331C1AD357E84.description:
Form questions that seek
additional information, rather than a
simple yes/no answer.

9D13CA61701F47EF9B8EBE5114DAA270.description:
Demonstrate the ability to produce
and expand complete sentences using
frequently occurring nouns,
pronouns, adjectives, verbs, question
words, and prepositions; name and
use in context number 0-100 (see
kindergarten mathematics standards
for Counting and Cardinality).

65238C7E2D0C451AB96C59D135114ACC.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of Standard English
grammar and usage when writing or
speaking; retain and further develop
language skills learned previously.

FDABC114D0BA4FFEAB958588B257BF18.description:
Demonstrate the ability to speak in
complete sentences and to form
questions using frequently occurring
nouns, verbs, question words, and
prepositions; name and use in
context numbers 0-10 (see prekindergarten mathematics standards
for Counting and Cardinality).

7954F2C8C0544D47B8099C677F1F955B.description:
Demonstrate command of
the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

1FB0CD1446A449FA94D00CBA79344BCA.description:
Speak audibly and express
thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

09F899D6660947FD843B12156C3FF5B8.description:
Speak audibly and express
thoughts, feelings, and ideas.

665797DFF67D4CE5B3AB760E070F2E2F.description:
Add drawings or other
visual displays to descriptions as
desired to provide additional detail.

9A9AD015436B488FBC028BEED47FC9F7.description:
Create representations of
experiences or stories (e.g.,
drawings, constructions with blocks or other materials, clay models) and
explain them to others.

DED181869CCC4E92A18C10727E35D4F9.description:
Describe familiar people,
places, things, and events and, with
prompting and support, provide
additional detail.

8F0F08F0346346CF90556A061A7B378B.description:
Ask and answer questions in
order to seek help, get information,
or clarify something that is not
understood.

393104BFE3FF44CFAADFC7D752BA1771.description:
Ask and answer questions
in order to seek help, get
information, or clarify something
that is not understood.

51C2197ADB2E4DF588D75073B6093F6E.description:
Confirm understanding of a
text read aloud or information
presented orally or through other
media by asking and answering
questions about key details and
requesting clarification if something
is not understood.

19E7BA21C7E34041ACC12F7BF61A7D23.description:
Recall information for
short periods of time and retell, act
out, or represent information from a text read aloud, a recording, or a
video (e.g. watch a video about birds
and their habitats and make drawings
or constructions of birds and their
nests).

CC640847BD934E6E8D825090F0B47575.description:
Continue a conversation through
multiple exchanges.

E1BB24E12A184E778E732700776B7449.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for
discussions (e.g., listening to others
and taking turns speaking about the
topics and texts under discussion).

AF589FFFC6B742BE80B84C2304A07E72.description:
Participate in collaborative
conversations with diverse partners
about kindergarten topics and texts
with peers and adults in small and
larger groups.

F8C0B564AA654413ADA266E1DEA36477.description:
Continue a conversation through
multiple exchanges.

BA91CB73DB5D437393DA2C7109D32FA5.description:
Observe and use appropriate ways
of interacting in a group (e.g., taking
turns in talking, listening to peers,
waiting to speak until another person
is finished talking, asking questions
and waiting for an answer, gaining
the floor in appropriate ways).

26C323E698F940849A1164F923328343.description:
Participate in collaborative
conversations with diverse partners
during daily routines and play.

9D35CB9B6D33464F936D116C5560ECE6.description:
Write or dictate writing
routinely for a range of tasks,
purposes, and audiences.

F78E141F485B45CFBAB8B653B9E55E52.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or
when the individual child is ready.)

752A45FBF77A45A9AF4524A0CF4BE543.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, recall information from
experiences or gather information
from provided sources to answer a
question.

06172B5465C34252B8A979717C28B39F.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or
when the individual child is ready.)

595694873FD14290BE7A4632FD7FD806.description:
Participate in shared research
and writing projects (e.g., explore a
number of books by a favorite author
and express opinions about them).

E2C95618B9A84007B4C20CAD5B1FF48B.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or
when the individual child is ready.)

267B84882D354520979C54D27A9AD357.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

F3E352CD284F48F9BA0A789653C6A6CD.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, explore a variety of
digital tools to produce and publish
writing, including in collaboration
with peers.

3FD38A5405194900ABE59EB48A1ADF7C.description:
Recognize that digital tools
(e.g., computers, mobile phones,
cameras) are used for
communication and, with guidance
and support, use them to convey
messages in pictures and/or words.

89478C393F9A418CBA96A34D4E0FBD59.description:
Demonstrate the ability to use
vocabulary appropriate for
kindergarten (as described in
kindergarten Language standards 4-
6).

4BF8EF1BC6E24D76AECC6BCC6E605ADC.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, respond to questions and
suggestions from peers and add
details to strengthen writing as
needed.

862CE0BCCE914A129945811524B113DC.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or
when the individual child is ready.)

60C7F22D7ECB4AE7BB22E1DE598B34A1.description:
Use a combination of
drawing, dictating, and writing to
narrate a single event or experience,
or several loosely linked events or
experiences; sequence the narrative
appropriately and provide a reaction
to what it describes.

230FA722F8704E9293D81E5AD96B3CE8.description:
Use a combination of
dictating and drawing to tell a story.

CA354A3BEB284C7C9C67DF914FAE487D.description:
Use a combination of
drawing, dictating, and writing to
compose informative/explanatory
texts that name and supply some
information about the topic.

A986FBBFB9BA44EBBC69302F209E4284.description:
Use a combination of
dictating and drawing to supply
information about a topic.

2570B76D7BAD42F6A269DEE315409D48.description:
Use a combination of
drawing, dictating, and writing to
compose opinion pieces that tell a
reader the topic or the name of the
book they are writing about and state
an opinion or preference about the
topic or book (e.g., My favorite book
is . . .).

9713885D12B44E2C900721332D062AB3.description:
Dictate words to express a
preference or opinion about a topic
(e.g., “I would like to go to the fire
station to see the truck and meet the
firemen”).

DF4B3D825D9343F49C66C15792A75204.description:
Read early-emergent-reader
texts with purpose and
understanding.

22B40B776C7A499A99B408D2A3AD3369.description:
See K standard (Begins in
kindergarten or when the individual
child is ready.)
Activities included here are meant to
build a foundation for the K
standard.

6C94EA65B76642AA8A940C719B9DBBF8.description:
Distinguish between similarly
spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

53AF88F460E244E7B5549F1BEE8B5906.description:
Read common high-frequency
words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you,
she, my, is, are, do, does).

2F96DE289466463BA7A3FBC5773449F6.description:
Associate the long and short
sounds with common spellings
(graphemes) for the five major
vowels.

586FDD9A09BE47D089C0547E5D41EF28.description:
Demonstrate basic knowledge of
one-to-one letter-sound
correspondences by producing the
primary sound or many of the most
frequent sounds for each consonant.

01AE662145B94A8EBFA0444FABDB548A.description:
Know and apply grade-level
phonics and word analysis skills in
decoding words.

15FF0791185B43D789C73ABA05FA4BD5.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or when
the individual child is ready.)

7138BF6F4113486791736056BD5703DC.description:
Recognize their own name and
familiar common signs and labels
(e.g., STOP).

EA97CE5ECDD649CE9D5FEBA3F292B51D.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or when
the individual child is ready.)

9C8A27BC498748539F1D7D54EAB217ED.description:
Link an initial sound to a picture
of an object that begins with that
sound and, with guidance and
support, to the corresponding printed
letter (e.g., link the initial sound /b/
to a picture of a ball and, with
support, to a printed or written “B”).

1A5862E92F1246D19A95E050F87BE826.description:
Demonstrate beginning
understanding of phonics and word analysis skills.

7D797A5E5C3D4CE88BD6A4124CDA89A9.description:
Add or substitute individual
sounds (phonemes) in simple, onesyllable words to make new words.

78C579072E534EA99A9F43C3A0EE59C4.description:
Isolate and pronounce the initial,
medial vowel, and final sounds
(phonemes) in three-phoneme
(consonant-vowel-consonant, or
CVC) words. * (This does not
include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or
/x/.)

0B66428A1E664031901B0D5670F3D40F.description:
Blend and segment onsets and
rimes of single-syllable spoken
words.

8BE12A3F87434817AED7E7B03C928E0D.description:
Count, pronounce, blend, and
segment syllables in spoken words.

713144F8A59E474DB8EFA06F704CFA3B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
spoken words, syllables, and sounds
(phonemes).

DE296F76E31B45BEA88EF4BCB6014849.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or when
the individual child is ready.)

05870C9D697A420999ADE62E83E1A95D.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or when
the individual child is ready.)

CDE7EFDDCB88473FB7569E2C1EA1BA37.description:
Identify the initial sound of a spoken word and, with guidance and
support, generate several other words
that have the same initial sound.

7206D7BBB3B146688FD9ADA8CB8250C9.description:
With guidance and support,
segment words in a simple sentence
by clapping and naming the number
of words in the sentence.

F8020DC780BC42219BCEF4D7B1D5FB56.description:
With guidance and support,
recognize and produce rhyming
words (e.g., identify words that
rhyme with /cat/ such as /bat/ and
/sat/).

5A122C0EAC604D5281A770CAE93D601E.description:
With guidance and support,
demonstrate understanding of spoken
words, syllables, and sounds
(phonemes).

B8E01E11115F48E8B2455E3EDB3FA602.description: Recognize and name all upperand lowercase letters of the alphabet.

66EAE37715594542A2B12EB19133CE81.description:
Understand that words are
separated by spaces in print.

7214D47A23BB4C619C4EB48DAE9CB298.description:
Recognize that spoken words are
represented in written language by
specific sequences of letters.

85B66490F630497D99E383505A1D918F.description:
Follow words from left to right,
top to bottom, and page by page.

6DFFB05587664D4B82664917EA3F13F7.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of the organization and basic features
of print.

F902B3F1347749DDBDCC45014DF20BB0.description:
Recognize and name some
uppercase letters of the alphabet and
the lowercase letters in one’s own
name.

6E83EAFE452949ABACF1D94DE03C9F7B.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or when
the individual child is ready.)

8A822BED744F4E48A98B3AC683DDD9B6.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or when
the individual child is ready.)

F0670D4D88EE42048BA5E53C8FA30119.description:
Handle books respectfully and
appropriately, holding them rightside-up and turning pages one at a
time from front to back.

1542D874C03A407EA95903249D46A0CA.description:
With guidance and support,
demonstrate understanding of the
organization and basic features of
printed and written text: books,
words, letters, and the alphabet.

BF0F73CC583848EA8E56D2C56D55DE1D.description:
Actively engage in group
reading activities with purpose and
understanding.

E0B0A2E0526A4EB4A3959FA5DA967AF6.description:
Listen actively as an
individual and as a member of a
group to a variety of age-appropriate
informational texts read aloud.

B18086028E46453596F19718A8806880.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7CE8997946CB41F4B3FAADA9EA71456A.description:
With prompting and support,
identify basic similarities in and
differences between two texts on the
same topic (e.g., in illustrations,
descriptions, or procedures).

992358E0ABAF4B47AD31A214AF358BB4.description:
With prompting and
support, identify several books on a
favorite topic or several books by a
favorite author or illustrator.

B4BA07A5EB0442AEBE9EEBA506AE29A0.description:
With prompting and support,
identify the reasons an author gives
to support points in a text.

77D331E133644FBBAE27D77AD5F0F562.description:
(Begins in kindergarten or
when the individual child is ready.)

2FB48A878CE44ED0AEB7ADA6DE268820.description:
With prompting and support,
describe the relationship between
illustrations and the text in which
they appear (e.g., what person, place,
thing, or idea in the text an
illustration depicts).

A58101DCA98C4AB3812AE482CEDF0421.description:
With prompting and
support, describe important details
from an illustration or photograph.

A4AEAC1731AA4E7EA7D265CDDAC340E7.description:
Name the author and
illustrator of a text and define the
role of each in presenting the ideas or
information in a text.

38F0A92A9ED141ED9D8FA2AF05725160.description:
With prompting and
support “read” illustrations in an
informational picture book by
describing facts learned from the
pictures (e.g., how a seed grows into
a plant).

4831AF14F5644204AA621AAF542D11F9.description:
Identify the front cover,
back cover, and title page of a book.

9C8C548E9EDD45E9A7ED635CAEA9ADE5.description:
Standard begins in
Kindergarten or when the individual
child is ready.

7497DF9252C84F0B8F4ACE4A970FCCA2.description:
With prompting and support,
ask and answer questions about
unknown words in a text.

82522705D5D04732AA35B943B69FA649.description:
With prompting and
support, ask and answer questions
about unfamiliar words in an
informational text read aloud.

01648E2F3E46445AAE05B81D54B21101.description:
With prompting and
support, describe the connection
between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in
a text.

435A540249B546819E0E7A2DD4541F49.description:
With prompting and
support, represent or act out concepts
learned from hearing an
informational text read aloud (e.g.,
make a skyscraper out of blocks after
listening to a book about cities or,
following a read-aloud on animals,
show how an elephant’s gait differs
from a bunny’s hop).

D0C8D1287BCE40558A3CA739D6FCB4C0.description:
With prompting and support,
identify the main topic and retell key
details of a text.

61C7371A229347A1A88040C9C312DB82.description:
With prompting and
support, recall important facts from
an informational text after hearing it
read aloud.

56C819EE1EDF4416ADA5906958C34BEF.description:
With prompting and support,
ask and answer questions about key
details in a text.

B6212C7122424D74A486EB02847FB43E.description:
With prompting and
support, ask and answer questions
about an informational text read
aloud.

A76F4ED9E2AA40D48CE841F6F999B6E9.description:
Actively engage in group
reading activities with purpose and
understanding.

3EC054998813444FAFEE4C4ADCDDBE68.description:
Listen actively as an
individual and as a member of a
group to a variety of age-appropriate
literature read aloud.

67BB82445B1240039CBF049C21E472C5.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

93B698100B924C108E41103975292725.description:
With prompting and
support, compare and contrast the
adventures and experiences of
characters in familiar stories.

DADEA0B12CEC43FF895A157543A62055.description:
With prompting and
support, make connections
between a story or poem and one’s
own experiences.

6170BE9FD7D146C0B41F634D73C8FBDE.description:
Describe the relationship
between illustrations and the story in
which they appear (e.g., what
moment in a story an illustration
depicts).

8AB99E30EDE8478A8E1B7A441EA530B3.description:
With prompting and
support, make predictions about what
happens next in a picture book after
examining and discussing the
illustrations.

8A63F45A51EF49CF9163DBDA56AEC70A.description:
With prompting and
support, explain that reading the
cover or title page is how to find out
who created a book; name the author and illustrator of a book and define
the role of each in telling the story.

077E32B498EB436D8F79C8ECCF78152A.description:
With prompting and
support, “read” the illustrations in a
picture book by describing a
character or place depicted or by
telling how a sequence of events
unfolds.

0F457B1E37424B06B68EC82149BC02C1.description:
Recognize common types
of texts and characteristics of their
structure (e.g., story elements in
storybooks; rhyme, rhythm, and
repetition in poems).

784E826339B44E6188DCF6FA344A8F0B.description:
Show awareness of the
rhythmic structure of a poem or song
by clapping or movement.

0029C31F74604ED49BAE7B6ABCB996E7.description:
Ask and answer questions
about unknown words in a text.
(See kindergarten Language
standards 4–6 on applying
knowledge of vocabulary to reading.)

64397172E5CE49B98F131F6FDF609043.description:
With prompting and
support, ask and answer questions
about unfamiliar words in a story or
poem read aloud.
(See Language standards 4–6 on
applying knowledge of vocabulary to
reading.)

18AFCF2E98E746298ED65AE54977C933.description:
With prompting and
support, identify characters, settings,
and major events in a story.

0EF80FAEE1CB4F219707867D93C24F39.description:
With prompting and
support, act out characters and events
from a story or poem read aloud.

E6813D1BD1854FCE8423B59B62042161.description:
With prompting and
support, retell familiar stories,
including key details.

66B204722158443182BC74A32E45042E.description:
With prompting and
support, retell a sequence of events
from a story read aloud.

D513CBE1D079434C86DE7D5BB44518C1.description:
With prompting and
support, ask and answer questions
about key details in a text.

0C9A3E73A8B649ACA8097B9550088E07.description:
With prompting and
support, ask and answer questions
about a story or poems read aloud.
